title: Compute model variable values to achieve target response
label100:
This dialog computes model variables to achieve target response value of the model
Note: If any non-numeric variable is present in the selected model, the target reponse computation will fail
modelSelection: Select a model to compute the optimal variable values
targetResponse: Specify the target response value (numeric) desired for the selected model
targetResponseLower: (Optional) Specify the lower target response value (numeric) desired for the selected model
targetResponseUpper: (Optional) Specify the upper target response value (numeric) desired for the selected model
label12: Variables (factors) in selected model listed below in the same order it appears in the model
factorConstraintUseDatasetLowerChk: Lower Bound Constraints: If checked, minimum value of each variable used in the model will be used for lower bound
factorConstraintLower: Lower Bound Constraints: (Ignored if checked above) Leave empty for no constraints on the lower bound for the model variable (i.e. factors) values. Otherwise, you must type comma-separated values for every model variable. If a particular model variable has no lower bound, type -Inf e.g., 0, 0.1, -Inf, 20
factorConstraintUseDatasetUpperChk: Upper Bound Constraints: If checked, maximum value of each variable used in the model will be used for upper bound
factorConstraintUpper: Upper Bound Constraints: (Ignored if checked above) Leave empty for no constraints on the upper bound for the model variable (i.e. factors) values. Otherwise, you must type comma-separated values for every model variable. If a particular model variable has no upper bound, type Inf e.g. 0, 0.2, 0.9, Inf
factorInitalValues: Starting Values: Leave empty for system to choose the initial starting values for model variable (i.e. factors) values (default: all zeros). Otherwise, you must type comma-separated values for every model variable e.g., 0, 0, 0, 0

help.title: Compute model variable (factors) values for target response for the model selected
